file_content.text: General? We got a little scorched, but we're inside Angral's battle cruiser.
Yes! I knew you could do it. Now to end that Sith for good.
Won't be that simple. The sensor logs of Angral's warship reveal he's amplified the vessel's reactors.
That's a little trick he learned from me, when I was interrogated by his spy on Taris. Blast his truth serums and mind probes....
Disarming the Desolator weapon will necessitate overloading at least three shielded reactor relays. No simple task.
Jedi + Kira = go to reactor relays // T7 = interface with warship computers + disrupt security protocols
Luck is with us. The refit to Angral's warship was... crude.
Knocking out any reactor relay will disrupt the Desolator's charge and shut it down.
Of course, those relays are certain to be well-guarded.
Jedi + Kira = go to reactor relay // T7 = interface with warship computers + disrupt security protocols
General, doctor... my team's moving out. We'll save Tython or die trying.
Sounds like a plan.
Don't even think that. I expect us all to reach a ripe old age.
I'd much rather have you at my side, Teeseven.
But I want you with me.
The feeling's mutual.
Me too, but I'll settle for you.
All three of us against Darth Angral? Sounds like fun.
Kira = not equipped to override Imperial security // T7 = logical choice
If this is an excuse to stay behind where it's safe, I'll have your memory wiped.
Don't disappoint me, droid.
T7 = get to work right away
Your signal's breaking up. May the--
Angral's jamming our transmissions. He's coming for us.
T7 = find computer access // Jedi + Kira = disable Desolator weapon + defeat Darth Angral
T7 = calculate 100 percent chance total success
Thanks for the vote of confidence, Teeseven. Be careful out there.
Good luck, buddy.
The Force = be with Jedi + T7 too
Let's hope so.
I don't need any false encouragement from you.
Don't patronize me.
I do. Thanks, Teeseven.
The Force = be with Kira + Jedi too
We're getting another emergency alert--from Tython. Relaying it now....
...under attack by Darth Angral. Launching defense fighters....
...Angral's battle cruiser... deploying... energy weapon... our ships can't escape Tython's atmosphere... we're trapped....
That explains why Angral left Uphrades so quickly. He's already chosen his next target.
Angral's going to incinerate Tython just like he did Uphrades.
The Jedi homeworld.
And finish what he started years ago--the annihilation of the Jedi.
Send everything you've got to Tython! Now, General!
Alert the fleet!
With all that tactical intelligence, how could you not see this coming?
You failed us, General.
There are more tactically advantageous targets to strike. Angral's acting from emotion, not logic.
The Republic fleet's in hyperspace. By the time it's redirected to Tython, it'll be too late.
The Desolator needs time to work. The Jedi may be trapped on Tython, but you're not.
You could board Angral's battle cruiser. Disable the weapon before it fires.
I'll disable that weapon--and Darth Angral will answer for his crimes.
I'm on my way.
There are other Jedi not on Tython. Send them to help me.
Tell the other Jedi.
I'll gather all the reinforcements I can find, but it'll take time.
We should take the Desolator intact. Turning it against the Empire seems only fair.
That weapon should be ours.
I agree--but one mission at a time.
I'll use the sensor logs to find the Desolator's weak point. Contact us when you're aboard Angral's warship.
May the Force be with you.
The Daybreaker is secured, General. The crew witnessed what Angral did here.
The ship's captain just transmitted sensor logs to the fleet. We've seen what we're up against.
I rescued the Daybreaker, General. I have sensor logs of Angral's attack.
However, the crew landed on Uphrades to help possible survivors. They're trapped.
We'll get them back somehow, but Angral's our first priority.
Transmitting sensor logs now....
My initial analysis indicates the Desolator has a similar flaw to the Planet Prison.
The weapon's excessive power requirements demand a lengthy charging period before it can fire.
Small consolation. Angral's next attack will undoubtedly be more direct.
The entire Republic should be warned about this.
We need to alert everyone.
Coruscant needs to begin food rationing immediately.
If he uses it on one of the Core Worlds, it will be catastrophic.
More damaging, as well.
An understatement. He could murder trillions.
You think he'll attack Coruscant again?
But where will it be?
Anything's possible. How do we defend against such careless hatred?
I'll contact the Galactic Senate and put every Republic world on--wait....
We've just picked up the tracking beacon's signal in the Uphrades system.
Tatooine is safe, but Darth Angral's warship has entered the Uphrades system.
That agriworld supplies nearly half of Coruscant's food. I'm scrambling the fleet, but you're closer.
My ship isn't equipped to fight a battle cruiser, but I'll think of something.
I'm already on my way.
Maybe the Empire will send forces to help us take down Angral?
What about the Imperial Navy?
The Empire's disavowed Darth Angral--but that doesn't mean they'll help us.
I'll handle Angral. By the time your ships arrive, there won't be anything left.
Your fleet won't be needed.
Angral's dreadnaught has a slight turbolaser advantage over your gunship.
Any damage to Uphrades's food production could cripple the Republic.
One warship can only destroy so much.
Tell that to Taris.
Transmitting Uphrades's coordinates. Good hunting.
General, the Death Mark has been destroyed--and I have news about Master Orgus.
Darth Angral broadcasted Orgus's execution over the HoloNet. Left the body floating in space for us to find.
A Republic shuttle just recovered the remains from the edge of the Alderaan system. I'm sorry.
Orgus taught me everything I know about being a Jedi.
He was a great teacher.
Darth Angral has no idea what he's brought on himself.
Your Master is dead, but he left us a gift.
You were friends a long time.
You have my sympathies.
Not many of us left from the old days. Orgus was... he was the best.
He sacrificed himself for a purpose.
I can't help feeling Orgus planned all this.
Orgus was up to something.
Somehow, he planted a tracking beacon on Angral's cruiser without the Sith realizing it.
Every time Angral's ship drops out of hyperspace, we know where. Orgus got the last laugh.
It was a brilliant strategy, but I wonder if the cost was too great.
A high price for victory.
He paid it so others wouldn't have to.
What if Angral finds the beacon Orgus planted?
You're sure?
By the time he realizes we can find him, it'll be too late. We'll make sure of that.
If Orgus had let me go with him, he'd still be alive. I could've killed Angral.
What a waste.
Maybe, maybe not. Regardless, the odds favor us next time.
Stand by... report coming through. Angral is on the move.
Until Angral shows himself, all we can do is secure our facility on Tatooine. Contact me when you're there. Var Suthra out.
General, doctor... good news. Master Kiwiiks and Seismologist Hare'en are safe. Even better, the Shock Drum was destroyed.
Destroyed? Blast. I wanted to inspect that prototype. Such a promising design.
The only thing it promised was to destroy planets. Honestly, I'm relieved it's gone.
General, I've secured your Shock Drum prototype. Send a recovery team to pick it up, along with Seismologist Hare'en and Master Kiwiiks.
Wonderful news. I have some thoughts for modifying the Shock Drum into an aerial bombardment device.
I'll send a transport to Tatooine immediately--but don't get ahead of yourself, doctor.
General, I've secured the Shock Drum's prototype. Master Kiwiiks and Seismologist Hare'en are watching over it. I told them you'd decide what to do.
We must preserve the prototype, obviously. It's a brilliant design. Many applications.
If we "apply" a planet-killing weapon, then we're as bad as the Empire.
Who wouldn't hesitate to use it against us.
Enough, doctor. I'm placing the prototype in deep storage. That's the end of it.
I've just received a surprising report from one of my cruisers in the area. A pure-blooded Sith Lord named Praven surrendered to it.
He mentioned your name. Anything I should know?
He was one of Darth Angral's apprentices, but he's joining our side. I promised we wouldn't hurt him.
Treat him well.
You keep finding new ways to impress me.
I wasn't sure he'd go through with it.
He actually surrendered?
This is almost unprecedented. It's only happened once before, and that was years ago.
He says he wants to join our side, but Sith lie all the time.
Keep an eye on him.
If it's a trick, he's going to be very disappointed.
I'll order my people to hand the Sith over to the Jedi Council. They'll know what to do.
Let's hope your mission to Alderaan goes as well as it did here. Var Suthra out.
The admiral was never here, General. This was a trap.
Blast... I'm sorry for putting you in harm's way on a lie. It won't happen again.
I'm afraid there's more bad news. Your Jedi Masters both missed their last two comm checks.
That isn't like Master Kiwiiks. What planet did you send her to?
Tatooine. Master Orgus went to Alderaan. I need you to find out what's happened to them and our weapon labs.
Understood, General--but there's more to the situation. This trap was meant for my Padawan. Kira is a fugitive from the Sith.
You should know about Kira.
I've just learned she's a "Child of the Emperor." Does that term mean anything to you?
It means even you Jedi aren't immune to Sith infiltration.
Your mission's too important to be compromised. That Padawan needs to go.
We're reporting to the Jedi Council immediately. They'll know what to do.
I'm taking her to Tython.
All due respect, this is a Jedi matter. The Council will decide how to handle it.
Your concerns are noted.
I trust they'll do the right thing. She should be locked up.
See? This is why I kept it secret.
Watch your tone. I'm not one of your little soldiers.
Don't bark orders at me.
No, you're a Jedi--and I expect you to treat me with some respect.
Children of the Emperor... what's next, armies of durasteel-plated rancors dropping out of the sky?
Understood, General--but first, I need to consult with the Jedi Council on an important matter.
I have business on Tython.
More important than saving the galaxy from Darth Angral? I'd like to know what that is.
The Sith are after my Padawan. It's a long story.
Kira's in trouble.
I'm sure it is, but we have no time to waste. Finish this business quickly.
Sorry, General. Jedi business.
It's classified.
Fine, if that's how you want to play it. But Angral's still out there.
I don't owe you any explanations.
Mind your own business.
Whatever your problem is, solve it fast. Our enemy could strike at any time.
May the Force be with us all. Var Suthra out.
Let's get this over with. Master Kiwiiks and Orgus need our help.
I could already be helping them if you hadn't sent me on a wild bantha chase.
Then don't delay me again.
It was a calculated risk. If the admiral had defected, we stood to gain so much.
Contact me as soon as you reach Tatooine or Alderaan. Var Suthra out.
You didn't tell him you were taking me to Tython.
What the general doesn't know won't hurt him. Figured you'd prefer if I kept this quiet.
That's Jedi business.
Don't do me any favors now. You'll ruin your perfect streak.
What I tell the general is my business. You still have an appointment with the Council.
Doesn't mean we're not going.
Wouldn't miss it for anything.
I figured you'd want to see the Jedi Council, first. Tell them about me.
The general doesn't need to know about you. Only the Council does.
That's the plan.
You don't have to keep secrets. I don't care who knows what I am.
Wasn't sure if you were prepared to face them yet.
Are you ready?
The sooner the Council knows about me, the sooner we can help Master Kiwiiks and Orgus.
I've decided no one else needs to know about you. Not the general, not the Council.
I'm keeping your secret.
Just you and the Emperor... and whoever he sends after me next.
You were ready to dump me. Now you're keeping my secret. What's the catch?
Everyone deserves a second chance, Kira. Even you.
There's no catch.
Just when I think I've got you pegged, you go and change. It's kind of infuriating.
You can have your little secret--but if you make one move against me, you're done.
Don't betray me.
Glad to see we're still friends.
Unless you want every Jedi knowing you're a traitor, do exactly what I tell you from now on.
Obey my every order.
As you wish... Master.
You're sure that's for the best? Keeping secrets isn't the Jedi way.
We're not so different, Kira. We follow our own paths, regardless of what the Council thinks.
It's my way.
Orgus and Kiwiiks need our help, and we're running out of time.
No point stirring things up when we've got a galaxy to save.
If you feel that strongly about it, we'll go tell the Council.
Then we'll go to Tython.
It's for the best. After all you've done for me, I don't want you getting in trouble.
What can I tell you? Guess I'm finally learning how to be a Jedi.
I'll be meditating in my quarters. Let me know when we're at Tython.
You're in no position to question my ethics.
Don't lecture me.
Sorry. I thought... never mind. Let's go find Master Kiwiiks.
I'm trying to be a good Jedi. You don't make it easy.
Let me know when we reach Tatooine or Alderaan. I'll be in my quarters.
A major tactical advantage has just opened up, but you have to act quickly.
One of Darth Angral's closest advisors--Admiral Hacklin--asked us for asylum. He wants to defect.
Hacklin was with Angral when he interrogated me on Ord Mantell. They seemed chummy. What changed?
Not sure, but the admiral is on the run. There are unconfirmed reports Hacklin's earned a death mark.
Let's help him. Anyone who earns a death mark from the Empire can't be all bad.
He needs protection.
Wouldn't go that far, but his tactical knowledge could prove invaluable.
One of Darth Angral's top men turned traitor? It's too convenient.
Sounds suspicious.
Exactly. This is obviously a trap.
Hacklin wouldn't be the first high-ranking Imperial to switch sides. Until we know otherwise, we have to believe this is real.
We shouldn't risk our necks to save some Imperial traitor.
Let him die.
Even a traitor who could give us everything on our enemy's operation? We need to bring him in.
Kira obviously made an impression on the admiral at Ord Mantell. He says he'll only surrender to her.
I have a bad feeling about this....
There's no time to negotiate. Admiral Hacklin's expecting you two--and no one else.
I told him to wait for you at an old asteroid mining facility. I'm uploading the coordinates now....
We'll bring the admiral in safely.
We're on our way.
What can you tell me about this place?
Asteroid mine?
The mining facility's abandoned, and well off standard hyperspace routes. It's the safest place we could find for the admiral.
Surround this asteroid mine with Republic cruisers. If this is a trap, I don't want the enemy escaping.
Send warships, too.
Too risky. The admiral might mistake it for hostile action and bolt.
The mining facility is small. If this is a trap, you won't be facing more enemies than you can handle.
Be careful out there.
General. Doctor Godera's on his way to you.
I can only imagine what the Empire would've done with him if you hadn't been there.
I'm also told you saved a Republic settlement from a Sith assassin.
Those colonists were lucky you showed up. How did you wind up there, anyway?
The Imperial spymaster warned me what the Sith was planning.
Watcher One tipped me off.
Division in the enemy ranks? Interesting. Let's hope there's more to come.
The Force guided me.
Wish I could see things before they happen. We wouldn't be in this mess.
It's my little secret.
Hmph. I'll take your word for it.
We've suffered enough today as it is. An entire bunker of colonists was slaughtered.
Women, children--no one was spared. Early reports indicate a lone Sith killed them.
Watcher One warned me about the attack. My only concern was rescuing Doctor Godera.
I knew it was happening.
That's... troubling. But I understand your decision. Don't envy you having to make that call.
The Imperial spymaster warned me that was going to happen. I didn't believe him.
Watcher One wasn't lying?
I wouldn't have, either. Don't blame yourself.
Get me the killer's name, and I'll remove that piece of filth from the galaxy.
Find this Sith.
We'll look into it, but I'm not hopeful of finding the killer.
Your work here may be done, but this isn't over.
We narrowly escaped a major disaster, General--but a lot of good people died.
Chief Rieekan and his agents are a terrible loss. What happened to Galen... well, at least he's alive.
Bad enough losing Chief Rieekan and so many agents. But Galen... we'd worked together for years.
Just heard from Special Agent Tander. His team eradicated all trace of what happened at that Sith base.
Thank you for destroying the Power Guard files. Approving that project was the biggest mistake of my career.
Never let fear compromise your ideals.
Learn from what happened.
If only it were that simple.
Dwelling on the past achieves nothing. Focus on the present.
Put it behind you.
It's the future that worries me right now.
The research was a failure. The Power Guards were no match for a Sith--or Jedi.
To say the least.
Another reason to put all this behind us.
But I told you to bury the Power Guard project. Why did you have him save the data files?
Maybe I just don't want you sweeping all this under the rug.
I'm keeping you honest.
Sometimes, honesty creates more problems than it solves.
Who knows what uses we might find for that technology?
Just in case.
If there's a way to make up for all that's happened, I hope we find it.
I believe in the Power Guard project. Anything we can use to kill Sith is worthwhile.
The research has merit.
If we do continue the research, it can't be there.
Not sure about this plan of yours to sabotage the Empire. It could blow up in our faces.
We'll give the Empire just enough information to get itself in trouble.
Not if we're careful.
It would be nice to see them on thin ice, for once.
If you're that worried, we don't have to do it.
It was only an idea.
It's worth pursuing. We'll just have to be extra careful.
I'm trying to salvage this mess you made. Support me, or stay out of my way.
Don't question my decision.
I'm sorry. Just feels risky, under the circumstances.
The Republic's position on Nar Shaddaa is precarious at best. Better for everyone if this operation remains classified.
I'm sealing all records of what happened here. You, me and the SIS are the only ones who know the full story.
Keeping secrets got people killed. The reason they died can't stay hidden.
The truth must come out.
I'll file a full report with my superiors--and hope they don't drum me out of the service.
If anyone else confronts me about this, I won't lie for you.
Jedi don't deceive others.
I'm not asking you to lie. Just use some discretion.
Don't worry, I'm not planning to discuss this with the Jedi Council.
Excellent plan.
It's for the best. Thank you.
I know you're probably exhausted, but the enemy hasn't given up. Neither can we.
I still need you on Taris. Set course for there immediately. Var Suthra out....
Bad news, General. We found Darth Angral's spy base, but an Imperial soldier destroyed the hyperspace data transceiver.
T7 did manage to download several messages from Angral's son--including the designs for a planet-killing weapon.
T7 = transmitting files now
Looks like Tarnis was combining all your weapon projects to create something code-named "Desolator." We believe Angral's arming his battle cruiser with it.
Then it's no coincidence I've lost contact with Agent Galen. The enemy is raiding our weapon research facilities to build that device.
Darth Angral already has the other weapons under his control. Agent Galen walked into a trap.
The enemy got Agent Galen.
What about Master Orgus and Kiwiiks? Have they checked-in?
Warn the Jedi Masters.
They went on comm-silence after leaving Coruscant. They're due to check in soon.
What planet was Agent Galen assigned to?
Where did the agent go?
Nar Shaddaa. It's Hutt territory--neutral--but the Empire has a strong presence there.
We can't let Darth Angral complete this Desolator weapon, whatever it is. I need your help stopping him.
Securing Nar Shaddaa is vital, but there's another target just as important on Taris.
You have another super-weapon on Taris you didn't tell us about?
I'd rather not say more until you're there.
How can I make an informed choice without information?
You're sending me in blind.
I can only do one mission at a time, General. What's more important--securing Nar Shaddaa or Taris?
Which planet matters more?
Nar Shaddaa is the immediate danger, but Taris holds the key to all of this. I'm trusting your Jedi instincts on this.
What else are you hiding, General?
Don't play games with me.
I'm not the one doing the hiding. You'll understand later.
Too many security breaches here; I won't risk the enemy finding out about this.
When you reach Taris or Nar Shaddaa, contact me. And good luck.
General, I've arrived at Ord Mantell.
Perfect timing. I've just finished coordinating things with my man on the ground there.
SIS Agent Ottau followed the enemy transmissions to a specific location planetside. He'll give you the full details.
Your T7 unit can interface with Darth Angral's hyperspace data transceiver and download his communications. Take the droid with you.
T7 = oiled + charged + ready for action!
Hmph. Guess I'll be playing dejarik against myself while you have all the fun.
I'm ready to go, General.
We have our orders.
This sounds dangerous. I want Kira as backup, not Teeseven.
You should come instead.
I'm afraid there's no choice. The droid is essential to mission success.
He's right. Scanning a hyperspace data transceiver is a little over my head. Besides, Teeseven can handle himself.
It's what you deserve.
I get that lesson a lot from you.
Take a shuttle to the surface and meet Agent Ottau. Good hunting. Var Suthra out....
I've visited my share of seedy ports, but this one's the seediest.
Just as well I'm staying behind. I'll make sure nobody steals our landing thrusters.
Take care of things here. We'll return soon.
Good plan.
Check out the spaceport while we're gone. If this place is as bad as you say, Darth Angral may have a presence here.
Investigate this place.
Wouldn't surprise me. I'll poke around and see what's what.
Don't pout.
Thanks for the vote of confidence.
Have fun down there.
